intro: Tephrosia ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow tephrosia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its small, pod-like fruits contain seeds that are dispersed by wind or animals. Tephrosia ochroleuca is also noted for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of bioactive compounds.
